name.vi: Giấy phép Công cộng Mozilla, phiên bản 1.1
name.ja: Mozilla Public License バージョン 1.1
name.zh-CN: Mozilla 公共许可协议，版本 1.1

release_notes.en-US: Remove Kickstarter campaign pop-up, since the campaign has succeeded and is almost over.

description.fr:
Ce module complémentaire ne sera plus pris en charge lorsque Thunderbird 78 sortira d'ici quelques mois, à moins qu'un nombre suffisant de personnes s'engage pour soutenir la poursuite de la maintenance du module et la rende possible. Pour montrer votre soutien, rendez-vous sur la page https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/jik/rewritten-add-ons-for-mozilla-thunderbirds-next-release et contribuez. En bonus, les contributeurs Kickstarter de ce module et de mes autres modules complémentaires bénéficieront de ristournes significatives sur les licences des modules complémentaires. The “Date” column in the Thunderbird / SeaMonkey thread pane shows the date from the header of the email message, which is not necessarily an accurate indication of when you received it. The “Received” column is supposed to show when the message arrived in your mailbox, but it does not work properly for IMAP folders. It will if you install this add-on! Two caveats:
  • This will take effect for newly received messages as soon as you restart Thunderbird or SeaMonkey. If you want to fix the “Received“ column values for messages that were already in a folder when you installed the add-on, then you must open the folder's properties dialog (right-click or ctrl-click on it and select “Properties...”) and click the “Repair Folder” button. Note that this will, unfortunately, reset your visible columns and their widths, so if you've made changes to the default thread pane layout for the folder, you will have to redo them afte repairing it.
  • Even if you sort by “Received”, threads will still sort by “Date”. This is due to a bug in the core Thunderbird code which can't be fixed in an add-on.
description.en-US:
This add-on will no longer be supported when Thunderbird 78 is released in a few months, unless enough people commit to supporting continued maintenance of the add-on to make it feasible. To show your commitment, please visit https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/jik/rewritten-add-ons-for-mozilla-thunderbirds-next-release and make a pledge. As a bonus, Kickstarter supporters of this and my other add-ons will receive significant discounts on add-on licenses. The “Date” column in the Thunderbird / SeaMonkey thread pane shows the date from the header of the email message, which is not necessarily an accurate indication of when you received it. The “Received” column is supposed to show when the message arrived in your mailbox, but it does not work properly for IMAP folders. It will if you install this add-on! Two caveats:
  • This will take effect for newly received messages as soon as you restart Thunderbird or SeaMonkey. If you want to fix the “Received“ column values for messages that were already in a folder when you installed the add-on, then you must open the folder's properties dialog (right-click or ctrl-click on it and select “Properties...”) and click the “Repair Folder” button. Note that this will, unfortunately, reset your visible columns and their widths, so if you've made changes to the default thread pane layout for the folder, you will have to redo them afte repairing it.
  • Even if you sort by “Received”, threads will still sort by “Date”. This is due to a bug in the core Thunderbird code which can't be fixed in an add-on.

summary.en-US: Make the “Received” column in IMAP folders show when messages were actually received.
